entry.title: Rising Solana Tide Surges 58% In Second Strong Week
entry.summary: The once-heralded "solana killer" has bounced back, briefly bumping Polygon out of the top ten.

entry.title: Republican Lawmakers Push Crypto Regulation With New House Subcommittee
entry.summary: Congressman Patrick McHenry wants to establish “clear rules of the road among federal regulators.”

entry.title: Former FTX US President Accuses SBF of ‘Gaslighting and Manipulation’
entry.summary: Following his sudden departure from FTX US in September, Brett Harrison describes prolonged tension with Sam Bankman-Fried.

entry.title: FTX Cleared to Sell LedgerX, Other Assets to Repay Creditors
entry.summary: Hoping to maximize recoverable value, the exchange also got approval to unload its subsidiaries and regional arms.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Gemini vs Genesis, Week 2: The SEC Steps In
entry.summary: Gemini CEO Tyler Winklevoss said his exchange looks forward to defending itself against the SEC’s “manufactured parking ticket.”

entry.title: Why the IRS Has an Interest in the FTX Bankruptcy Case
entry.summary: The IRS hasn't made its intentions clear, but it has an attorney assigned to the case—and tax experts say there’s good reason for that.

entry.title: Art Blocks NFT Faithful Partied in Marfa as FTX Collapsed
entry.summary: While the biggest crypto meltdown of 2022 was playing out, Art Blocks was further building up its unique community by getting weird in Texas.

entry.title: Why Ethereum Bulls Are Turning to LSD
entry.summary: Liquid-staking derivatives are the hottest thing as Ethereum devs gear up for the Shanghai network update.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: 2023 Green Streak Continues for Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, Avalanche
entry.summary: Encouraging inflation news and a strong stock market kept BTC and ETH green this week, and brought big boosts to SOL, AVAX, and LDO.

entry.title: Bitcoin Surges Past $20K, Erasing Post-FTX Losses
entry.summary: The price of Bitcoin has jumped by more than 17% in the last seven days.

entry.title: From 'Bitcoin Billionaires' to SEC Charges: A Brief Crypto History of the Winklevoss Twins
entry.summary: The Winklevoss brothers hit it big in crypto after the Facebook settlement—but now they’re in a $900M spat and the Gemini faces charges.

entry.title: You Can Now Stake Ethereum on MetaMask—Should You?
entry.summary: To stake, or not to stake? That is the question, Ethereum holders.

entry.title: Ethereum Developers Say Shanghai Upgrade Remains on Track for March
entry.summary: Developers this week successfully launched a devnet and a shadow fork to prepare the network for its much-hyped Shanghai upgrade.

entry.title: Dungeons & Dragons Wants Nothing to Do With Web3 or NFTs
entry.summary: After backlash, Wizards of the Coast is rethinking some Dungeons & Dragons changes—but Web3 is apparently still in the crosshairs.

entry.title: Nexo 'Vehemently Denies' Allegations of Fraud Following Arrests in Bulgaria
entry.summary: Crypto lender Nexo says Bulgaria's investigation is "politically motivated" but will not confirm if the arrests involved company employees.

entry.title: Europol Takes Down Crypto Call Center Fraud
entry.summary: A joint effort by Eurojust and Europol saw law enforcement take down call centers promoting bogus crypto investment opportunities.

entry.title: Why a 'Tiny' NFT Game Is Ditching Solana for Ethereum's Immutable X
entry.summary: Tiny Colony, a building and management game, is the latest NFT project to announce a shift away from Solana.

entry.title: Grayscale: SEC Argument for Blocking Bitcoin Spot ETF 'Illogical'
entry.summary: In a response to the SEC shared with Decrypt, Grayscale argued that the regulator's "central premise" for rejecting its ETF application is illogical.

entry.title: Binance to Support Terra Classic Upgrade Eliminating Re-Minting of Burnt LUNC Tokens
entry.summary: The industry’s largest crypto exchange Binance has confirmed it will support the upcoming network upgrade of Terra Classic (LUNC).

entry.title: First Fan-Owned SailGP Team DAO Opens to Investors
entry.summary: The new professional racing team is run as a decentralized autonomous organization, with token holders having a say in everything from team livery to athlete hires.

entry.title: SEC Crackdown on Gemini ‘Late to The Game’: Congressman Tom Emmer
entry.summary: Emmer argued that the SEC’s “after-the-fact” enforcement actions against Gemini and its Earn product aren’t in users' best interests.

entry.title: Wyre Lifts Withdrawal Limits After Fresh Funding From Strategic Partner
entry.summary: The injection of fresh capital reverses a 90% withdrawal limit that crypto payments firm Wyre implemented last week.

entry.title: Victims of ‘Textbook Ponzi’ BitConnect to Receive $17 Million in Restitution
entry.summary: The DOJ has ordered to distribute over $17 million in restitution to 800 victims of BitConnect’s multi-billion crypto fraud.

entry.title: Centralized vs Decentralized Metaverses: What's the Difference?
entry.summary: A metaverse is an expansive, immersive, and all-encompassing digital version of the analog (real) world.

entry.title: Decentraland Leads Metaverse Token Rally After Optimistic CPI Report
entry.summary: As recession fears wane, metaverse and NFT-related coins, like Decentraland’s MANA, posted positive gains.

entry.title: Crypto.com Cuts Workforce for Third Time Since June
entry.summary: Crypto.com is cutting 20% of its staff. The CEO cited ongoing economic headwinds and the unforeseen FTX collapse for the downsizing.

entry.title: Bitcoin Inches Toward $19K as Recession Scare Subsides
entry.summary: The original cryptocurrency is seeing some bullish action as the broader financial market sees light at the end of the economic tunnel.

entry.title: Polygon Proposes Hard Fork to Reduce Reorgs, Gas Spikes
entry.summary: Fork it? Polygon has plans for a substantial upgrade in less than a week.

entry.title: Silvergate Writedown Casts Doubt on Future of Meta’s Failed Stablecoin Project
entry.summary: The crypto bank valued the stablecoin project that it bought from Meta at 98% less than it did a year ago.

entry.title: SEC Hits Genesis, Gemini With Securities Law Violations for Gemini Earn Program
entry.summary: SEC Chair Gary Gensler says compliance with securities laws is "not optional."

entry.title: FTX Liquidators Lost $74K in Wrapped Bitcoin in 'Embarrassing On-Chain Faux Pas'
entry.summary: The restructuring team overseeing the FTX and Alameda Research bankruptcy process is trying, and failing, to navigate DeFi, on-chain data shows.

entry.title: Miss Universe El Salvador Walks the Stage Holding Giant Bitcoin Staff
entry.summary: “You don’t need a sash to walk around dressed as cash, like El Salvador,” said the pageant’s announcer.

entry.title: Nexo Hit by 'Flood of Withdrawals' Following Office Raid Over Money Laundering Investigation
entry.summary: Blockchain analysts say large withdrawals of over $100,000 have rushed out of the crypto lender. But Nexo says "it's business as usual."

entry.title: Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT Sales Spike Ahead of Yuga’s Dookey Dash Game
entry.summary: Trading rises as Yuga Labs reveals a game that requires a Bored Ape NFT to claim an access pass—and teases rewards for players.

entry.title: NFT Passes for a Zoom Call With Donald Trump Are Selling for Under $25
entry.summary: Believe it or not, NFT tickets for a 2,000-person group call with former U.S. president Trump aren’t in hot demand.

entry.title: DCG Mulls Venture Portfolio Sale to Shore up $3B Genesis Shortfall: Report
entry.summary: Digital Currency Group is reportedly looking to sell off some of its venture portfolio to make up Genesis’ $3 billion debt.

entry.title: SBF's New Substack Blames CZ for 'Quick, Targeted Crash' That Brought Down FTX
entry.summary: ‘I have a lot more to say,’ FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried wrote in a newly-launched Substack written from house arrest.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Hold Ground After Further Signs of Inflation's Retreat
entry.summary: Inflation in December slowed, lifting positive expectations about the size of future interest rate hikes and helping along Bitcoin's price.

entry.title: Bill Gates Doesn’t Think Web3 Is a Big Deal
entry.summary: For the Microsoft co-founder, the future lies in artificial intelligence rather than Web3 or the metaverse.

entry.title: Coinbase to Shutter Bulk of Operations in Japan
entry.summary: A small crew will stay on at Coinbase Japan to safeguard customer assets while the entity transitions to its next iteration.

entry.title: Walking the Red Carpet at The Crypties 2022
entry.summary: Sander on the Street is back! Decrypt's Sander Lutz walked the red carpet and accosted attendees as they arrived at the inaugural Crypties awards gala in December 2022 at Art Basel in Miami, presented by Decrypt Studios.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Highlight Reel
entry.summary: In December 2022 at Art Basel in Miami, Decrypt Studios held the inaugural Crypties awards gala. With emcee Josh Ostrovsky ("The Fat Jewish") and presenters from a range of crypto projects, statuettes were awarded in nine categories. The evening was sponsored by Polygon, Filecoin Foundation, Lamina1, Async, BeetsDAO, The Gold Mask, Gem Set, Breakout, Anonymous, Infinite Objects, Ape Water, Decentralized Pictures, and Vault 721.

entry.title: gm: Zora Looks Beyond NFTs to DAO Creation
entry.summary: Zora sees itself as more than just an NFT marketplace; its next era is about helping people easily launch a DAO. Zora Co-founder Jacob Horne joined Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward to talk competition, the NFT speculative boom and bust, how Zora and Nouns are connected, and why Zora thinks DAOs are the future. Watch Episode 27 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Tezos Was Ahead of the Proof-of-Stake Merge: Web Summit 2022
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman talks about how the Tezos blockchain has used a proof-of-stake mechanism since its inception, her admiration for Tendermint, Ethereum and sharding, progressive decentralization, and NFT gaming with Decrypt's Stephen Graves onstage at Web Summit in Lisbon.

entry.title: gm: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce Critiques SEC's Approach to Crypto
entry.summary: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has been an outspoken advocate for crypto and a candid critic of her own agency’s approach to regulating crypto markets. In an extensive chat with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott she discussed FTX, Gary Gensler, DeFi, and the problems with the Howey Test. Don’t miss this conversation for the inside take on the SEC’s thinking on crypto—straight from the source. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.
